channel.title: Php sql
channel.description: Hmm whats the php code to check a table..well idk how to describe it well... name..................id............ur.............logged in hiaburi 0 3 1 killz 1 2 0 I know there is a code to do it and i think its like one easy line... but i forgot what it is, i need it to check the logged in value of a certain name.... so it would check the table, and check the name, and check the names loged in value... sorry if no one understands what i need.

item.title: Php sql
item.dc:creator: @Night26 Night26
item.description:
@Night26 wrote:

wait if you want to check the logged in value of a certain name…

you use
[php]
if($row = mysql_fetch_array(mysql_query(“Select loggedin from tbl_name where name = ‘$name’”))) {
// $name is the name ur lookin for
echo $row[‘loggedin’];
}
[/php]

Read full topic

item.title: Php sql
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

yea that looks like what i was using, sept i thought it also had name in there some were to? if not o well, thanks that should work

Read full topic

item.title: Php sql
item.dc:creator: @Night26 Night26
item.description:
@Night26 wrote:

$query = mysql_query("Select * from `tbl_name` where `loggedin` = '1'") //tbl_name should be replaced with ur table...
while($row = mysql_fetch_array($query)) {
       echo $row['ur']; // all the column fields are in the $row array. 
}

hope it helps…

Read full topic
